subject: Marketing
title: Context-Dependent Pricing
description: A fast breakdown of Context-Dependent Pricing for builders.

hook.text: A bottle of water costs $1 at a store, $5 at a stadium, and $50 in a desert. Same water.

buildup.text: People accept wildly different prices for the same product based on context.

discovery.text: Context signals scarcity, urgency, and social expectations about what's reasonable.

twist.text: A $15 cocktail feels wrong at a dive bar but right at a rooftop lounge.

climax.text: The product hasn't changed. The story around it hasâ€”and that story sets the price.

punchline.text: Context doesn't influence price. Context is price.

quiz.question: Why do people accept different prices for the same product?
options: Context signals scarcity, urgency, and social expectations
They don't notice the price difference
Different locations have different production costs
